title: Affordable Care Act Means Big Business For Private Vendors
teaser: In some states that didn't embrace the health law, the result is that big money is landing in the pockets of private contractors.
contentencoded:
Now that the full enrollment period is over, we’re starting to get an idea of how the Affordable Care Act’s health care exchanges are working.

The federal government gave out billions of dollars to states to help set them up. In some states that didn’t exactly embrace the health law, the result is that big money is landing in the pockets of private contractors.

From the Here & Now Contributors Network, Todd Bookman of New Hampshire Public Radio reports.

  • Read more on this story via NHPR

Reporter

  • Todd Bookman, health reporter for NHPR. He tweets @bookmannhpr.
